decks.notes: The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to quickly establish board presence through efficient and aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Gurmag Angler, and Young Pyromancer. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Cabal Therapy and Force of Will to control the opponent's game plan. It aims to pressure the opponent while also disrupting their strategies, utilizing a mix of cheap spells and powerful creatures to overwhelm the opponent and ensure victory. The inclusion of cards like Lightning Bolt and Daze adds further versatility and adaptability to the deck's game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing lands as both a source of control and win conditions. By utilizing cards like Exploration, Life from the Loam, and Mox Diamond, the deck aims to quickly ramp up its land presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Wasteland and Ghost Quarter. The key combo in the deck is the Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage combo, allowing for a quick 20/20 indestructible flying token. The deck also includes Punishing Fire for removal and various utility lands like Maze of Ith and Glacial Chasm for protection.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Dark Depths combo by combining Thespian's Stage with Dark Depths to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. The deck utilizes cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Expedition Map to tutor for the necessary lands, while also using hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to protect the combo. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Pithing Needle and Sylvan Safekeeper for protection against opposing disruption spells. Overall, the key strategy of this deck is to efficiently assemble the Dark Depths combo and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful creature.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence of Merfolk creatures with powerful tribal synergies like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident, supported by mana acceleration from Aether Vial and disruption from cards like Daze and Force of Will. Chalice of the Void helps to control the opponent's spells, while True-Name Nemesis provides a difficult-to-answer threat. The inclusion of Smuggler's Copter offers additional card selection and evasion. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient disruption to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Elesh Norn, using cards like Entomb and Faithless Looting. By casting spells like Reanimate and Exhume, the player can bring these creatures back onto the battlefield for a powerful and fast win condition. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Unmask and Cabal Therapy to control the opponent's hand and field. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures early in the game and win before they have a chance to respond.

This deck focuses on controlling the game with artifacts while utilizing aggressive blue spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It aims to quickly establish a board presence with cards like Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas and Walking Ballista, while also utilizing cards like Chalice of the Void and Force of Will to control the opponent's plays. The deck also has a combo with Thopter Foundry and Sword of the Meek to generate an army of flying creatures. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around using artifacts and blue spells to control the game and apply pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain control of the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Force of Will, Counterspell, and Snapcaster Mage to control the board and protect key threats like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, the deck aims to grind out the opponent and outvalue them in the long game. Cards like Terminus and Supreme Verdict provide board sweepers when needed, while Search for Azcanta helps filter draws and generate additional card advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish board presence with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf, Delver of Secrets, and Deathrite Shaman while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will, Hymn to Tourach, and Abrupt Decay. The deck also aims to control the board with key removal spells like Fatal Push and Liliana of the Veil, while also utilizing mana denial with cards like Wasteland. This aggressive strategy allows the deck to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's strategy, leading to a quick victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Lotus Petal in order to cast powerful creatures like Inferno Titan and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. By utilizing Sneak Attack and Through the Breach, the deck can cheat these creatures into play early for devastating impact. Additionally, the deck uses disruption cards like Blood Moon and Chalice of the Void to hinder opponents' strategies while setting up its own game-winning combos. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its explosive plays and high-powered threats.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using Cloudpost and Glimmerpost lands, along with mana acceleration artifacts like Grim Monolith and Thran Dynamo. By using Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Oblivion Sower to disrupt the opponent's game plan and big finishers like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Kozilek, the Great Distortion, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with massive threats. Cards like Trinisphere and Sorcerous Spyglass help control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy, allowing the deck to execute its game plan effectively.

The focus of this deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's strategy while maintaining card advantage and control of the board. The deck utilizes cards like Rest in Peace and Energy Field to shut down graveyard and combo strategies, while also using Helm of Obedience to eliminate threats. Counterspells like Spell Pierce and Force of Will help protect the player's game plan, while card draw spells like Brainstorm and Preordain ensure consistency. Creatures like Monastery Mentor and Jace, the Mind Sculptor provide additional win conditions and value.

The key concept of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of hand disruption, counterspells, and removal spells while generating card advantage with cards like Young Pyromancer and Gurmag Angler. The deck aims to control the game's tempo with efficient spells like Brainstorm, Preordain, and Ponder, while also having a flexible sideboard for adapting to different matchups. Ultimately, the deck seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through a combination of control elements and threats.

The deck focuses on playing efficient threats early on, such as Tarmogoyf, Nimble Mongoose, and Delver of Secrets, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Wasteland, Stifle, and Force of Will. It aims to control the tempo of the game by utilizing counterspells like Spell Snare and Spell Pierce, while also applying pressure with burn spells like Lightning Bolt. The deck's mana base allows for consistent access to its diverse array of spells, and can quickly close out games through a combination of aggression and disruption.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal, and board wipes to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The key strategy is to maintain a Standstill on the battlefield to prevent the opponent from casting spells while building card advantage through cards like Search for Azcanta and Snapcaster Mage. The deck also utilizes planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor for additional card advantage and control. The land base is designed to provide the necessary mana requirements while also including utility lands like Mishra's Factory and Karakas.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by disrupting the opponent's plans with counterspells, discard spells, and removal. It also maintains card advantage with card draw and graveyard interaction. The creatures in the deck provide additional value and can be used to pressure the opponent. The mana base allows the deck to effectively cast its spells and adapt to different situations. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and secure victory through strategic plays and careful resource management.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures while disrupting their game plan with disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck aims to use its mana acceleration from lands like Ancient Tomb and Eldrazi Temple to play threats ahead of schedule and close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Warping Wail and Dismember provides additional versatility and answers to a variety of threats.
